issues.summary: RTE Systems - Ensure new team labels and comply files are linked and aggregated in DORA dashboards
issues.description:
Ensure that the newly formed *Market Innovation and Optimization (MIO)* team labels and Comply files are correctly linked and aggregated within the *DORA dashboards*, replacing the previous RTE Systems squad (RTE Systems) details. This will help maintain accurate tracking of key performance indicators such as deployment frequency, lead time for changes, change failure rate, and mean time to recovery.

*Action Items:*

* Review the current DORA dashboard configuration and identify existing RTE Systems references.
* Update team labels to reflect the MIO team across all relevant dashboards.
* Ensure Comply files are correctly linked and aggregated within DORA metrics.
* Validate that all key metrics are accurately displayed and aligned with the new team structure.
* Conduct a review with stakeholders to confirm proper tracking.

*Reference:*

* [DORA Metrics |https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/PLAT/pages/3903685457/How+to+correctly+get+assigned+DORA+dashboard+metrics+into+your+squad]

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* All MIO team labels and Comply files are correctly linked and aggregated within the DORA dashboards.
* The [DORA dashboard|https://tableau.hellofresh.io/#/views/DORAmetrics/Overview?:iid=1] display accurate metrics aligned with the new team structure.
* Confirmation from stakeholders that the updates meet reporting requirements.

issues.summary: NVS - Update team & Claim JSON files with proper team details on applicable repos
issues.description:
Update the *team and Claim JSON files* across applicable repositories to reflect the correct team details for the newly formed *Market Innovation & Optimization (MIO)* team, previously managed under the New Ventures Systems squad (NVS).

This task involves modifying ownership information and ensuring that all relevant repositories accurately represent the updated team structure.

*Action Items:*

* Review the provided payload to identify necessary updates.
* Update team and Claim JSON files with the correct MIO team details.
* Ensure consistency and accuracy across all applicable repositories.
* Submit pull requests for review and approval.

*Reference:*

* Use the provided [PR|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/.teams/market-launch.json] as a guideline for implementing the changes.

{noformat}{
  "name": "market-innovation",
  "githubTeam": "hellofresh/market-innovation-and-optimization",
  "tribe": "new-ventures",
  "alliance": "consumer-mega",
  "jiraPrefix": "MIO",
  "slackChannel": "#squad-market-io",
  "slackAlertsChannel": "#mio-live-alerts",
  "skipLabelsOnPR": false
}{noformat}

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* All relevant repositories have updated team and Claim JSON files.
* PRs are submitted, reviewed, and approved.
* Changes are validated to ensure accuracy and compliance with internal guidelines.

issues.summary: Backend services handover documentation
issues.description:
We need to document and align with all stakeholders on the handover and/or deprecation of backend services.

* Complete operational service handovers to other domains following the TRE guidelines.
* Develop a high-level  [+New Ventures: Backend services Ownership and Future plans+|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1shgXBKw6Mfz2uRnHWvSIBnlLmDxi1f71s5SZUqlJWEk/edit?tab=t.0] outlining the deprecation of all TAM backend services.
* Create TRE Handover Guides (e.g.,[+[RTE Manufacturing - Youfoodz] B2B Ownership TRE Handover Guide+|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ySmlmm15SnFye3yB1Fo_TJOuRKaMIB0Nd0uoQR1zEy0/edit?tab=t.0]) by end of 2025. Attach to this ticket and create separate tasks for each.
* *Schedule & Sync:* Finalize by Week 2â€“3 of 2026.
* *Kickoff:* Begin in Week 4 of 2026, with completion targeted for Q1 2026.

Backend service list:

issues.summary: Quarantine System: checkoutWithOrderConfirmation.spec.ts
issues.description:
Quarantined System
Spec: checkoutWithOrderConfirmation.spec.ts
https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/61496
153 test runs, 23 test failures, 6 test retries, 85.00% test success rate

Quarantine System is a system that is used to prevent flaky tests from being executed. It is designed to be used in conjunction with the following best practices:
- Test data is not deterministic: Avoid relying solely on random values for testing. Instead, consider using deterministic test data that consistently align with the expected outcomes. This approach ensures more predictable and reliable test results.
- DOM Selector Reliability: Pay attention to the reliability of DOM selectors used in tests. Duplicate selectors or selectors that appear after a delay can lead to flaky tests. Aim to use unique and stable selectors to ensure consistent test behavior.
- Test Execution Time: Avoid making assumptions about specific times in tests. Test scenarios should be designed to handle different time frames and dynamically adapt to the current date/time. This approach increases the flexibility and resilience of the tests.
- Following the Cypress best practices https://docs.cypress.io/guides/references/best-practices

You can use the https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/61496 to revert the changes and add your fixes to the spec.

Find more information about the quarantined system here: https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FI/pages/3949987114/Reduce+the+flakiness+for+web+tests

You can also reach out to the team at #good-chop-alerts or #squad-web-foundation s to discuss the quarantined system.

issues.summary: Add Statsig feature flag for GreenChef migration
[SubscriptionLoading] Create useOrderConfirmationData hook
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

Create a UI hook {{useOrderConfirmationData}} that wraps the existing useCustomerOneTimeOrder data-access [hook|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/data-access/customer-orders/one-time-orders.ts#L117] with UI-specific logic for the subscription-loading/order-confirmation flow.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Technical Notes*

*Hook Name:* {{useOrderConfirmationData}}

*Location:* {{app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/my-deliveries-components/src/pages/loading-subscription-content/order-confirmation/hooks/useOneTimeOrderConfirmationData.ts}}

*Hook Responsibilities:*

* Extract {{orderId}} from URL query parameters or localStorage
* Call {{useCustomerOneTimeOrder}} with required params
* Transform response into UI-ready format

API Doc [https://reactivation-bff.staging-k8s.hellofresh.io/docs/#/OneTimeOrders/one-time-order-by-id|https://reactivation-bff.staging-k8s.hellofresh.io/docs/#/OneTimeOrders/one-time-order-by-id]
*Request to /one-time-order/{id)*

{code:json}//Path Parameters
"orderId": 019a9e13-099a-70c2-8229-1ae4e7d19358 (UUID format)

//Query Parameters
"locale": "en-US" //set by default
"country": "US" //set by default
"brand": "goodchop" {code}

*Hook Structure*
The {{useOneTimeOrderConfirmationData}} hook returns a UI-optimized object with:

* *Core Data (ready to display):*
** {{recipes}} - Flat array of transformed recipes with images, names & quantities
** {{deliveryDate}} - ISO date string for delivery
** {{orderId}} - The order identifier
** {{price}} - price information including item_total_price, shipping _price &_ grand_total
* *Additional Info:*
** {{deliveryAddress}} - City, street, and postcode
* *State Flags:*
** {{isLoading}} - True while fetching data
** {{isError}} - True if any API call failed
** {{isEmpty}} - True when no recipes (after loading)
** {{hasOrderId}} - True when orderId is available
** {{error}} - Error object for debugging
{panel}

{panel:bg

issues.summary: Hide the payment banner for the C@C flow

comments.author: Alexander Matlin
comments.body:
h2. Clarifying Questions for Implementation Planning

Based on analysis of the codebase and the ticket requirements, I have the following questions:

*1. Which experiment determines banner visibility?*
The ticket references the {{mr_one_time_purchase_mvp}} Statsig experiment. I found two related experiments in the codebase:

* {{mr_one_time_purchase_mvp}} (used in plans flow, returns {{isControl}} boolean)
* {{mr_charge_at_checkout}} (used in payment page, returns {{shouldPerformCharge}})

Which

comments.author: Alexander Matlin
comments.body:
h1. Implementation Specification: Hide PaymentAnxietyBanner for C@C Flow

h2. Goal

Hide the {{PaymentAnxietyBanner}} component on the {{/checkout/payment}} page when a customer is allocated to the Charge at Checkout (C@C) experiment variation. This is a temporary experiment that may need to be rolled back.

h2. User Stories

* As a customer in the C@C experiment variation, I should not see the payment anxiety banner on the checkout payment page
* As a customer in the control group (BAU), I shou

comments.author: Alexander Matlin

issues.summary: NVS - Update Sentry teams & Alerts
issues.description:
Update the *Sentry teams and alert configurations* to reflect the newly formed *Market Innovation and Optimization (MIO)* team, replacing the previous New Ventures Systems squad (NVS) ownership.

This task involves modifying Sentry settings to ensure that all error tracking, alerts, and team assignments are correctly aligned with the MIO team structure.

*Action Items:*

* Review current Sentry team configurations and alert rules.
* Update ownership details to assign MIO as the responsible team.
* Ensure alert routing and notification settings reflect the new team structure.
* Validate changes by triggering test alerts where applicable.
* Document any updates made for future reference.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Sentry reflects the updated MIO team ownership.
* Alerts and notifications are correctly routed to the appropriate MIO channels.
* Changes are tested and verified for accuracy.
